Questions.name: What is overfitting?
Questions.answer: Overfitting is when the model is too complex for the data, and it starts to learn the noise in the data rather than the signal.  This is a problem because the model will perform well on the training data, but will perform poorly on the test data.

Questions.name: What is underfitting?
Questions.answer: Underfitting is when the model is too simple for the data, and it is unable to learn the signal in the data.  This is a problem because the model will perform poorly on both the training data and the test data.

Questions.name: What is the bias-variance tradeoff?
Questions.answer: The bias-variance tradeoff is the tradeoff between the bias of the model and the variance of the model.  A model with high bias will perform poorly on the training data, while a model with high variance will perform poorly on the test data. The goal is to find a model that has low bias and low variance.
